column4: Can someone give me a hand configuring an ATI Radeon on a fresh install of Gutsy? Restricted drivers allows me to enable it. It reboots, runs reconfigure and I get back without it functioning.
Should I use the proprietary or opensource drivers for an ATI Radeon on a fresh install?
which radeon?
I am not sure, but I will check just a sec.
Radeon 9550xl
then I'd suggest using the free (default) driver
particularly if you're mainly interested on compiz
Ok, but, how can I get into a res that is above 800 x 600...
pastebin your /var/log/Xorg.0.log
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/41385/
Was that the paste you were looking for?
Ok, got it...
yeah sorry I missed it
No problem, I know it's crazy here....I am capable of following whatever direction, I've just never personally dealt w/ ATI issues...I have nvidia myself...
well you should switch to the "ati" driver
when I enabled restricted...it rebooted and asked me what driver...I selected ATI and it rebooted back without change...But I selected opensource not proprietary...Should I use proprietary instead?
run sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg
Run that at term now, then reboot? or logout to term and run it?
restarting X should be enough
Ok, I ran the command, now I'll give it a whirl.
Ok, great that worked perfectly...I am having an issue getting compiz to start but I will take that to #compiz...Thanks a lot!
#compiz-fusion :)
I know....I was just being lazy...=)
